description.p: Monks of the Way of Chronal Flow focus their ki to slightly bend time to their whims. Their training allows them to create slight changes in the flow of time and harness this natural force. Peering into the the near future, they confuse foes with unpredictable moves, and are adept at evading and striking in unexpected ways.

description.p: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you have begun to peer into the future and anticipate your foes' actions. You gain the following benefits.
Battle Precognition. You cannot be surprised while you are conscious, and you add your wisdom modifier to initiative rolls.
Punishing Strike. When a creature misses you with an attack, you can immediately use your reaction to make an unarmed strike against that creature.

description.p: At 6th level, you gain the ability to shift through the flow of time, and your future sight lets you affect your course of action. You can spend 2 ki points to cast mirror image, blur, or augury, without providing material components. Additionally, you gain the guidance cantrip if you don’t already know it.

description.p: At 11th level, your power to influence the flow of time with ki manifests. Whenever you spend a ki point to use Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense or Step of the Wind as a bonus action, you may make an extra unarmed strike as part of your bonus action.

description.p: At 17th level, you can deftly manipulate time. During combat, you can take an extra turn. You may choose at which point during initiative order you do this. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
